issue.subject: Changing integrated PHP proxy
issue.description:
"Surrogafier" php proxy is not able to support POST requests and cookies.
Whith such constraints, MAP is not able to work properly and Apache proxy path must still be used (which can be difficult to manage regarding the Internet Provider you work with).

So, it is important to find another PHP proxy which supports fully features of MAP.

In the mean time, it is important to add a tooltip inside MAP options interface (over label Proxy) explaining such behaviour: _"Type in a specific PHP proxy that MAP must use; if empty, it means that MAP uses the one per default integrated inside easySDI"_

journals.notes:
We have developed a proxy php to replace the "Surrogafier" which is not answering our needs in eaSYSDI MAP.
This proxy supports GET, POST and cookies. 
It is included in CORE component and already used in easySDI for other functionnalities.

We propose to set this proxy as default one in the MAP component and get rid of the "Surrogafier".
Do we have to keep the proxy php as an option? The integrated proxy PHP could be used in any cases.
Security of this proxy PHP must be enhance before validating its integration.

Hi TC,

As far as I understand ,the surrogafier php proxy was not configured to secure any caller or any proxyied endpoint.
As it is important to secure quite a bit the new php proxy, I propose that TC validates such issue and open new enhancement about php proxy security (there is no less security than now).

So, is TC able to validate such old issue with the 2 main points:
* new integrated php proxy becomes the default one for easySDI extensions
* there is no more option about php proxy in MAP and SHOP components' configuration as it will always be used by easySDI

Hope that you agree with such proposal :-)
Where can I find this proxy to test it?

Hi Thomas,

-> /components/com_easysdi_core/controllers/proxy.php

FYI: it's actually used by the datatable translation system
SHOP component does not use the param 'proxyphp' available in component options. So, this option is removed.
